name: com.htc.upm.vive-input-utility
description:
The VIVE Input Utility (VIU) is a toolkit for developing VR experiences in Unity, especially with the VIVE/VIVE Pro but also targeting many platforms from a common code base including Oculus Rift, Rift S Go, Quest, Google Daydream, VIVE Wave SDK (e.g. VIVE Focus standalone) and additional VR platforms as supported by Unity such as Microsoft's 'Mixed Reality' VR headsets and more.

Compatible with SteamVR 2.4.0+ and Oculus Integration 16.0+.

View license:
https://github.com/ViveSoftware/ViveInputUtility-Unity/blob/develop/LICENSE.md

samples.description: This example shows how to build up the basic environment that can interact with Unity built-in UI component.
This example extends from 0.Tutorial example to introduce more UI components and developers also can re-use UGUI components from their previous projects to work with Vive Input Utility seamlessly.
This example introduces drag and drop action with scripts. Developers can use Vive Controllers to drag and drop game objects in this scene.
This example introduces teleport in 3D space. Developers can use Trackpad to teleport in this scene.
This example introduces various types of collider events and using Rigidbody script to allow developers to apply forces to the object and control it in a physically realistic way.
This example introduces various ways of controller interactions.
